RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 83. Claiming Purse 14100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 13, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since November 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered F or $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and TEC Racing (Elliott S Logan)

RACE.FOOTNOTES: TRINGALE took the lead two deep into the first turn and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths pole and was steadily handled to late stretch. ROYAL THUNDER raced off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path on the far turn but had to settle for second best. FORT FORTITUDE briefly had the lead inside through the front stretch then stalked into the first turn, gave chase from the half mile pole but dropped back approaching the quarter and flattened stride in the lane. CHARLIE POTATOES rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and raced in the five path on the far turn, but showed little in the stretch. HAPPY CHAMP raced in the five path the first turn, gave chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. NOMO RON rounded the first turn about the four path, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn, the rider lost his whip leaving the turn and showed little more. JUNGLE WARRIOR saved ground into the first turn and never factored. SHOULDA HAD IT raced in the six path on the first turn and was not a factor. This race was hand timed

ENTRY.NAME: Charlie Potatoes
ENTRY.OWNER: Knapp Richard M and Brafman Larry N

ENTRY.NAME: Happy Champ
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 67. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12, 500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BERTRAM FLIGHT pressured the pace while between horses, contested at a close disadvantage two deep on the turn and dug in determinedly to earn the nod in later yards. TEACHINTHERELEASE was forced out leaving the gate then pressed the pace inside, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in gamely from the head of the lane but relented the nod in later yards. I'LLTAKECAREOFIT was shuffled back on the chute but gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn, finished well while drifting outward through the stretch and was gaining on the top two. DONNIE B gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the lane. JUBA'S HAT TRICK chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. IN HIGH GEAR came out at the break then gave chase, rounded the turn about the five path and showed little in the lane. CATS DIAMOND BOY set a pressured pace, was met leaving the five sixteenths pole, dropped back past the quarter and weakened in the three path on the turn. BOBBYS CASE LOAD was not a factor. TALKING TEDDY was forced outward leaving the gate and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: In High Gear
ENTRY.COMMENT: came out break,chased,5p turn,little in lane

ENTRY.NAME: Teachintherelease
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,pressed inside,rail turn,game lane,relented

ENTRY.NAME: I'lltakecareofit
ENTRY.COMMENT: shuffled back chute,chased,off rail turn,finished well,gaining

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 86. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 26700. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-win ners Of A Race Since April 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 13 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SARGENT KOBE settled off the rail on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole and came between horses midway on the far turn, took the lead approaching the head of the lane, dueled briefly clear past the eighth pole but held on under steady handling. BUFF'S EYE VIEW raced well back about the three path on the first turn, bid leaving the three eighths pole and circled rivals in the six path on the far turn, dug in through the stretch and took second in the final strides. BOSS E BOOGS settled in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole and took a brief slim lead three wide midway on the far turn, but dropped back passing the eighth pole and was outfinished in the duel through the stretch. FEARNOUGHT saved ground on the first turn, eased out and gave chase leaving the turn, rounded the far turn off the rail then angled to the outside in the upper stretch and ran evenly in the lane. AARON'S TAP settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced in range of the lead in the four path on the far turn but flattened inside the eighth pole. SUPER GARNER stalked the early pace two deep, took the lead nearing the seven sixteenths pole and came under pressure toward the quarter, was met at the rail midway on the far turn and gave way in the lane. THUNDERINREADYRICK set the early pace inside, was met toward the seven sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back toward the three eighths and gave way on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Thunderinreadyrick
ENTRY.OWNER: Bass Tamera L Perry William M and Perry Susan D
ENTRY.COMMENT: early lead inside,met near 7/16,chased,gave way far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Fearnought
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,eased out,chased 1/2,off rail turn,even finish

ENTRY.NAME: Super Garner
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked 2d,up past 7/16,met rail mid turn,gave way

ENTRY.NAME: Sargent Kobe
ENTRY.COMMENT: settled off rail,bid 3/8,between turn,up near 1/8,held on driving

ENTRY.NAME: Buff's Eye View
ENTRY.COMMENT: well back 3p,bid 3/8,circled 6p far turn,up 2nd final strides

ENTRY.NAME: Aaron's Tap
ENTRY.OWNER: A and B Racing Stable LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Allowance Purse 34800. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $25,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CASTLE LIGHTS contested the pace from the start and raced close two deep through the turn, took the nod toward the eighth pole and dug in determinedly to inch away from MACKENZIE'S MUSIC, who contested the pace from the start, kept the edge nearest the rail most of the turn, was met toward the eighth pole, stayed on gamely to late stretch before relenting and just lasted for second. COACH RUBE chased, rounded the turn in the three path, dug in from the head of the lane and just missed second. FULL MOON LOVER gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn then flattened the final sixteenth. MOONLIT SHADOW chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path and finished well outside. JACKS SISTER JILL chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn then flattened stride. MANAROLA gave chase, raced in the four path of the turn and showed little in the lane. THUNDER PUNCH saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Full Moon Lover
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Mackenzie's Music
ENTRY.COMMENT: contested pace,edge rail turn,met near 1/8,game lane,relentd late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 62. Maiden Special Weight Purse 29400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE YEARS OLD. Weight, 122 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PINK DINGHY closed to the front at the half mile pole and rated a clear pace, came under pressure approaching the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the stretch. JAZZ WITH DENIS was bumped off stride at the break, picked up the chase through the backstretch, raced near the rail on the turn and settled for second. GREY BOUQUET was bumped then pinched back leaving the gate, gave chase from well back, angled out through the turn and entered the stretch about the eight path and came along for third inside the sixteenth pole. MAKIN' GOLD gave chase, raced in the three path on the turn and showed little in the lane. GEORGE chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. COURT TUDOR ducked in and made contact with both Grey Bouquet and Jazz With Denis leaving the gate, gave chase out of the chute, entered the turn off the rail but angled to the seven path through the turn. LITTLE RICHIE chased outside, raced in the four path on the turn, drifted toward the head of the lane and weakened. ROAD PUNCH chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Punch
ENTRY.OWNER: Don't Chasem Replacem Racing and Armstrong Jay

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 96. Allowance Purse 30500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since Apri l 13 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 13 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ICING rated the pace inside, came under pressure toward the quarter pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and widened under vigorous stretch urging. ONE NIGHT MIKE settled in the three path on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in range in the three path on the far turn but proved no match in the lane. LOVERBOY LOU settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path and cleared third mid-stretch. MR. PETE raced in the three path the first turn, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. UNCAPTURED KING raced in the four path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn in the four path and showed little in the stretch. AUBURN MILL tapered in through the front stretch and stalked two deep, picked up the chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn. PRINCE OF FENTON stalked the early pace inside then faded through the backstretch. CAMINERO raced in the four path on the opening turn and never factored.

ENTRY.NAME: Icing
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,pressured near 1/4,rail turn,vigorous urging

ENTRY.NAME: One Night Mike
ENTRY.COMMENT: off pace 3p,chased 7/16,range 3p far turn,no match lane

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured King
ENTRY.OWNER: Murdock Stephen and Marceda John A

RACE.RACE_TEXT: Coin Collector S. CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 89. Stakes Purse 75000. FOR REGISTERED ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA BRED THREE YEAR OLDS. $50 nominations close Wednesday, May 3, 2023. $50 to enter with a purse of $75,000 Added. Entries close Wednesday, May 10, 2023 by the usual time of closing. The added monies and all fees to be divided 60% to the winner, 20% to second, 11% to third, 6% to fourth, and 3% to fifth. Weight: 122 lbs. Field will be limited to ten starters with up to four alternates. Preference to those horses having accumulated the highest career earnings at the t ime of closing of entries. Trophy to the winning owner.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LITTLE ROO ROO was bumped on the chute then gave chase into the backstretch, raced close off the rail on the turn, lugged in while taking the lead mid-stretch and dueled clear late yards. HONEYQUIST rated the pace inside, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn, dug in under steady encouragement but was met mid-stretch and relented later yards. JUBA'S NOTION chased through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. LORD OF CORK chased well off the rail through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the five path and finished evenly to pass rivals. GREAT SPIRIT came in and made contact with Little Roo Roo and stumbled on the chute, angled to the outside and gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn then flattened in the lane. EL LUCERITO chased inside then flattened at the rail on the turn. KAYLEE'S SPITFIRE chased outside, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. COLT ROCK engaged in close early chase then flattened at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

ENTRY.NAME: Honeyquist
ENTRY.OWNER: Mammas Boys Thoroughbred Racing Group LLC Ultra Championship Racing LLC and Mill

ENTRY.NAME: Lord of Cork
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,well off rail,5p turn,passed rivals,even finish

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 15200. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE NOVEMBER 13, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since November 13 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,5 00, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).

CLAIM.OWNER: Diamond Oak Stable and Splurgin Racing

RACE.FOOTNOTES: KUKULKAN accelerated to the lead approaching the three eighths pole and set a pressured pace, contested the edge at the rail on the turn and was steadily handled in the stretch. MOSS BOSS chased through the backstretch and raced in range of the lead in the four path on the turn, cleared second mid-stretch and was gaining late on the winner. BIG DADDY D R came away awkwardly and picked up the chase leaving the half mile pole, raced off the rail on the turn and came along for third later yards. STEVETHEVANDRIVER had a brief early lead then pressured the pace from the three eighths pole, raced close two deep on the turn but flattened toward mid-stretch. WE B SHACKIN gave chase from well back, rounded the turn in the four path and showed little in the lane. FREEDOM IS RINGING chased inside, raced off the rail on the turn and flattened in the stretch. BIG HAMBONE gave chase toward the outside, raced in the six path at the quarter pole, rounded the turn about the four path and showed little in the lane. STARSHIP TAXI gave chase, raced in the six and seven paths on the turn and weakened in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Big Daddy D R
ENTRY.COMMENT: awkward break,chased,off rail turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Kukulkan
ENTRY.COMMENT: up near 3/8,edge rail turn,steadily urged lane
